note.p: Death: Alleyn park, West Dulwich, London (23 March or 23 May 1910)
Burial: Elmer's End cemetery, near Beckenham, Kent

Career: Worked in Bengal for the junnior branch of the Great Trigonometrical Survey of India; promoted to snior branch (1854); visited England (1863); introduced to India the reproduction of survey sheets using the photo-zincographic process (1865); Deputy Superintendent Great Trigonometrical Survey of India; Fellow Commoner, Jesus College, Cambridge; retired (1884); settled in England
Notes: DNB gives death date as 23 May 1910
